name: Hybrid fish-plankton model

affiliation.name: Department of Geoinformatics - Z_GIS, University of Salzburg

description:
This model comes in six alternative designs, where Design 4 was shown to be most adequate in representing the spatially explicit fish-plankton system.


*   Design 1: Agent (fish) – stock (plankton) ↔ school-agent (fish) – stock (plankton)
*   Design 2: Agent (fish) – stock (plankton) ↔ spatial stock (fish) – stock (plankton)
*   Design 3: Agent (fish) – stock (plankton) ↔ stock (fish) – stock (plankton)
*   Design 4: Agent (fish) – spatial stock (plankton) ↔ school-agent (fish) – spatial stock (plankton)
*   Design 5: Agent (fish) – spatial stock (plankton) ↔ spatial stock (fish) – spatial stock (plankton)
*   Design 6: Agent (fish) – spatial stock (plankton) ↔ agent (fish) – stock (plankton)
referencePublication: Wallentin, G., Neuwirth, C., Dynamic hybrid modelling: Switching between AB and SD designs of a predator-prey model. Ecol. Model. (2016), http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.ecolmodel.2016.11.007
